body: the message is not in good English, other then that  LGTM

I've fixed the English messages.
All is green. LGTM level reached. Ready to merge.

cc @swill
Given our discussion on mailing list and code review, LGTM.
Thanks for the help! =)

_Comment created by [`upr comment`](https://github.com/cloudops/upr)._
@ProjectMoon can you reopen this against at least 4.7, maybe even master.  Thanks...
Does this need CI?

@syed can you provide details for how to add `ike-scan` in order to run the test and verify via CI?  Not sure how I feel about adding a test that can't be run without modification to the setup.  Is it the management server that needs `ike-scan`?  If so, that is easier to handle...

Also, can you repush this or close and reopen?
@swill Some parts need to be rewritten so that won't be on time I'm afraid.
LGTM

@swill 
Pardon me - I was on leave for a week. I'll get this force pushed momentarily.
@dsclose  you can close/reopen this PR instead.

@swill rebased with latest master
@GabrielBrascher fixed the typo
LGTM

@swill, i had a nice weekend, thanks. The test that is failing throws a different kind of exception if I run it on master in my bubble. I have just pushed a limited part of the change to see what it does and if the exception is still the same.
@swill, the test_scale_vm didn't error out because it wasn't run on this version! I have lost a tiny bit of confidence in our travis runs again. I will now start adding the rest of the code again.

@dsclose we install this patch in our environment(ACS 4.7.1, KVM) to solve the password issue with RVR. 

We found the new password for VM is still incorrect unless we restart the password service manually. Should it be OK since we have destroy and rebuild VR ?

@luhaijiao I've seen the same error in our XenServer setup but wasn't sure what the cause is. I'd be surprised if this was the cause but it's worth exploring.

I will try to boot some system VMs now without this patch to see if the password server starts properly and then apply the patch to see if it subsequently fails. I'll report back here shortly.
New version of #1406, opened against master instead of the 4.6 branch.
Have opened #1559 against master.

got the test to run locally with

```
mvn clean install
ssh cs0 /data/shared/helper_scripts/cloudstack/build_run_deploy_test.sh -m /data/git/cs1/cloudstack/setup/dev/advanced.cfg -S -s -t -f /data/shared/helper_scripts/cloudstack/run_scale_vm.sh
```

or

```
ssh cs0 /data/shared/helper_scripts/cloudstack/build_run_deploy_test.sh -m /data/git/cs1/cloudstack/setup/dev/advanced.cfg -S -t -f /data/shared/helper_scripts/cloudstack/run_scale_vm.sh
```

, so the rest is office-time-work
@swill I don't think so, CI doesn't test this feature. It is a script for INSIDE Guest Instances.

@DaanHoogland, I've added the piece we were talking about, this can be found it the logs regarding loading the driver dynamically :

> 2016-05-23 05:42:57,880 DEBUG [c.c.u.d.T.Transaction](localhost-startStop-1:null) (logid:) Successfully loaded DB driver com.mysql.jdbc.Driver for connection jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/cloud?autoReconnect=true&prepStmtCacheSize=517&cach
> ePrepStmts=true
> 2016-05-23 05:42:57,896 DEBUG [c.c.u.d.T.Transaction](localhost-startStop-1:null) (logid:) Successfully loaded DB driver com.mysql.jdbc.Driver for connection jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/cloud_usage?autoReconnect=true&
> 2016-05-23 05:42:57,898 DEBUG [c.c.u.d.T.Transaction](localhost-startStop-1:null) (logid:) Successfully loaded DB driver com.mysql.jdbc.Driver for connection jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/simulator?autoReconnect=true
@nlivens supakoel

@luhaijiao I reverted to a vanilla Cloudstack 4.8.0 ISO. The cloud-passwd-srvr service failed to start. The following appears in /var/log/messages on the router:

`Password server failed with error code 1. Restarting it...`

The same was true with this patch as well. In both cases, manually restarting the service (as the root user) was successful. I think we should treat the password server issue as separate and raise that elsewhere.

I'll kick off the tests again here.
LGTM though it remains kluncy to some extend I think this is a considerable improvement over what we had

Thanks Daan,

Does that mean we're good to go?
Changed db.x.path to db.x.driver as @DaanHoogland suggested
ping @swill tag:<your favorite let's take the next step tag here>
@NuxRo it means debugging the problem has started. what is in here now is not much (you can review it)
@DaanHoogland moreover it is proven in Nuage lab to resolve the issues we had
everything looking good now it seems - time to merge @swill ?

@rhtyd, @koushik-das, @remibergsma, @abhinandanprateek, @rafaelweingartner 

anyone wants to further review ? We would like votes :)
Thanks!

Thanks @swill , @GabrielBrascher
@remibergsma ok, no problem.  Thanks for the heads up.  :)
Ok, so I have two LGTM both with validation that the code behaves as expected.  I think that is enough for this to get in.  Thanks...
